item.title: Its not for rsps its for java
item.dc:creator: @sn1p3d sn1p3d
item.description:
@sn1p3d wrote:

RSPS222:

Int Bauk i know i need to load it from a txt file BUTTTT HOW!?!?!?!??!?!?!??!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!

This is a method that will show you how you create text files.

private void createFile(String usr){
      //This will create a .txt file for every username.
      private Formatter f;
      private File path;
      //This is the path that you want to save the names of the users at.
      path = new File("C:\\EnterPathYouWantToSaveToHere\\" +usr);
      //This checks to see if the file exists already (this method is built in)
      if(path.exists())
            //This says if the file already exists execute this piece of code, and don't create the file.
            System.out.printf("The username %s already exists, please try again.", usr);
      else
            //This says if the file doesn't already exist then execute this piece of code.
            System.out.printf("Thank you for registering %s", usr);
            //This creates the new file.
            f.format = new Formatter(path);
}

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Black Not, post:17, topic:472251”][quote author=Frell link=topic=589976.msg4178286#msg4178286 date=1355228647]
every time someone enters a name on an instance of that horrid code (assuming its a website) have it append to a file

on startup scan file line by line and store all taken names in an array

array names = new shit
read a line broski
names.pushpenis(line)

for (i=0; i < names.length : i++) {
if (currentname == names[ i ]) {
aintnobodygottimefodat = true;
break;
}
}

im used to lua and javascript so I have to cope with shit. I can’t remember if break; works in for loops. IIRC it does in javascript because I had to do it for vaykant
[/quote]
No you wouldn’t use break; in a conventional Java for loop.[/quote]Yes, you would use break if you want to terminate the loop only and have it continue onto the next line after the loop.

item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“RSPS222, post:29, topic:472251”]Int bauk now i understand the code and i know basic java i am not that noob Bro
OK so box is the only stored name but iwant it to automatic store name when i am registring and also i saw the boolean:

        boolean randomBoolean = Boolean.parseBoolean("box");
    and then

public void randomBooleanVoid() { if(randomBoolean == false){ System.out.println("Name not taken."); } else if(randomBoolean) { System.out.println("Name taken, try again!"); } }
thats mean if it automatic store another name its should open a new public void example:

[code]
boolean randomBoolean2 = Boolean.parseBoolean(“box”);

    public void randomBooleanVoid2() {
            if(randomBoolean2 == false){
                    System.out.println("Name not taken.");
            } else if(randomBoolean2) {        
                    System.out.println("Name taken, try again!");        
            }
    }[/code]

i think that what it should do if no the explain me both (how to automatic store and randomBoolean2)
-Ty bro-[/quote]

no, i don’t think you quite understand. all of that code was an EXAMPLE of storing and reading (in a shit way).
i wouldn’t use this because you would manually have to add users to the string, where as if you read it from a .txt of some sort, you can read and load all directories created by the user.

item.title: Its not for rsps its for java
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“RSPS222, post:24, topic:472251”]you know how to do it?
and you know what all this do NEW To booleans ?:

[code]
boolean randomBoolean = Boolean.parseBoolean(“box”);

    public void randomBooleanVoid() {
            if(randomBoolean == false){
                    System.out.println("Name not taken.");
            } else if(randomBoolean) {        
                    System.out.println("Name taken, try again!");        
            }
    }[/code][/quote]

you converted your booleans to integers, USE BOOLEANS. i also showed you what i meant with the code above.

let me re-phrase, the code above is just showing you ‘simple’ storing, if you like.
storing: if the name isn’t already stored, print “Name not taken.”, if it’s already stored print “Name taken, try again!”. that’s all the above code is doing. so far, the only stored ‘username’ is box. so anything other then box processed will say “Name not taken.”, but if you used box it would say “Name taken, try again!”. do you now understand what i’m trying to say???

now google all type(s) of data storage, then learn to read/write using them.

item.title: Its not for rsps its for java
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“RSPS222, post:18, topic:472251”]Look guys , what to add to this code:

[code]
import java.util.Scanner;

public class website_singing {
public static void main(String args[]){
//_______________________________
//DO NOT COPY WIHOUT PREMISSION! |
// COPYRIGHT |
//_______________________________|

            Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
            boolean b = true;
            int age;
            String name;
            age = 18;
            if(age < 18){
                    System.out.println("ERROR: you cant singing this website under Age 18");
                    
            }else{
            if(age >= 18){
                    b=false;
                    System.out.println("Enter Your Name:");
                    name = input.nextLine();
                    if(b==true){
                            b=true;
                            System.out.println("Name Taken,Try another name");
                            }else{
                                    if(b==false){
                                            b=false;
                            System.out.println("Name Not taken");
                                    }
                            }
                    System.out.println("Enter Your Age:");
                    age = input.nextInt();
                    System.out.println("You Singed up to this website Using Name " + name + " and using Age " + age );
                    System.out.println("You Singed UP Succeful!");
                    }
                    }
    }[/code]

AND IF THIS CODE NOT GOOD CAN SOME ONE TEACH ME HOW TO MAKE GOOD ONE?
Thats what im asking[/quote]

i was trying to give you an example, on conventions and storing. store the names then read them.
